article.headline: Robert Morris 74, Fairleigh Dickinson 40
article.story: TEANECK, N.J. -- Rob Robinson scored 20 points to lead Robert Morris to an easy 74-40 win over Fairleigh Dickinson on Saturday night. Jeremy Chappell finished with 12 points, five rebounds, four assists and six steals for the Colonials (13-7, 8-1 Northeast Conference), while Dallas Green added 10 points and also pulled down five rebounds. Cameron Tyler had 14 points for the struggling Knights (4-15, 4-5), who committed 26 turnovers and made just 36.8 percent of their shots. Robert Morris was in command for most of the game, jumping out to an 8-2 lead and closing the first half with a 12-4 run -- featuring six points by Robinson -- to take a 38-23 lead at the break. The Colonials then maintained double-digit leads throughout the second half and closed the game with a 15-3 run. Robert Morris also won the battle of the boards, outrebounding FDU 32-27.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
